comment: This was his first time teaching this class. The class was fairly easy because of clearly laid out instructions in resources from other professors. Vry nice man, but not completely understanding in english which made answering student's questions extemely hard, with a clear answer. He offered many extensions because of the work load of assignments.

Dr. Zheng is a very kind man, but I did not enjoy his instruction. The content/instructions were consistently confusing, and he wasn't very responsive to questions (except via synchronous sessions). He clearly recycled someone else's course plan and had multiple incorrect due dates listed for assignments.

- Required text was not used. Instead, the course constantly referred to a text we did not have. When we asked, we were told to "memorize" the wrong book and decide which parts to use. - All assignments have two deadlines and he did not know which one to use. - Assignments were not graded in a timely manner.
Dr. Zheng takes forever to grade stuff. She often changes deadlines of assignments, but this is usually in favor of the student.

This was a completely online class. He was inaccessible for most of the semester and took forever to respond to emails. His syllabis say he takes 2-3 weeks to grade assignments, but its more like 6-8 weeks. Difficult assignments with very little feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: Taking him for an online class - EDRS 8000. He doesn't stick to due dates. He changes what point values assignments are worth. He provides no valuable feedback. But according to open ga records he makes a nice $105,000 to be this bad at his job. He takes forever to grade assignments. I'm pretty sure he just moves due dates to avoid grading things.

Was personable and responsive but gave different responses to different ppl. Constantly shifted due dates for projects. Did not follow syllabus or modules even though he told us to follow them. Gave busywork not applicable to career objectives. Did not record grades accurately. Nice enough, but proceed with caution.
Assignments were constantly changed due to technology issues and he is very flexible on due dates if you ask for an extension.

His instructions are very unclear, he has multiple rubrics and directions posted, there are no examples.  The assignments are a waste of time, there is no connection to this class and becoming a better teacher.
Nice. Unclear. Does not give specific feedback. Horrible teacher. No examples. Does not provide clear direction.

Professor Zheng is an absolute sweetheart. He is intelligent, flexible with due dates, cares about his students, and is very passionate when it comes to teaching. However, he is kind of unorganized and tends to get off track while lecturing. Still take him though, you'll love his personality!
Brilliant and kind man. Horrible horrible horrible teacher.  learned nothing. boring class. waste of time.
A big waste of time!  I have had him in two graduate courses!!!!
Not always an exciting class, but usually not too bad.  Dr. Zheng is very nice and always helpful.  If you show up, participate, and do the required reading you should make an "A".
Dr. Zheng was very knowledgeable about his subject of Educational Research, but the class was entirely lecture and was a bit tiring.
